_header: But we hope we shall the thee a privy thing
_description: Mocking imprecation at conclusion of a letter from Lord Grey de Ruthyn to Griffith ap David ap Griffith, A.D. 1400 — seven monorhyming lines

BLCottCleoFIII.Transcription:
But we hoepe we shall do þe a pryue thyngeA Roope a Ladder and a
                    KyngeHeighe on Gallowes for to hengeAnd þus shall be your
                    endyngAnd he þat made þe be þer to helpyngeAnd we on
                    our behalf shall be well willyngeffor þy lettre is
                    knowlechynge
BLCottCleoFIII.Note:
Folio number reflects the most recent foliation. Written as
                    prose.
